title: Students accuse lecturer of sharing Russia war lies
description: Academics have been criticised for spreading misinformation about the war in Ukraine on social media.

title: Corby Pole Fair: The ancient celebration held once every 20 years
description: Nobody in Corby is certain as to exactly when the Pole Fair started or why it got its name.

title: On board HMS Northumberland with ship's chaplain
description: HMS Northumberland's deployment changed considerably due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: Borgen: How the Danish political drama has been 'reinvented'
description: The series returns to Netflix this week, nearly a decade after its highly-praised original run.

title: How India’s first all-women newsroom is creating a media revolution
description: Khabar Lahariya is the first and only newsroom in India run entirely by women from marginalised backgrounds.

title: French Open: Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic set for Roland Garros quarter-final
description: Novak Djokovic says he is ready for the "biggest challenge" at the French Open when he plays 13-time champion Rafael Nadal in the quarter-finals.

title: Cultra beach find: 'Dad I just picked up a grenade. Is it real?'
description: Cole Chapman, who is 11, was out hunting for crabs when he picked up an unexploded grenade.

title: Great British Bake Off winner Frances Quinn makes giant Jaffa Cake
description: A former Great British Bake Off winner has beaten her own giant Jaffa Cake record.

title: Champions League final: Fan videos of crowding and pepper spray
description: Footage from fans attending the Champions League final shows scenes of chaos.

title: 'I watched from afar Russia’s latest merciless assault on Severodonetsk'
description: Quentin Sommerville describes relentless artillery bombardment in Donbas ahead of Russian forces entering Severodonetsk.

title: Scot Tom Stoltman retains World's Strongest Man title
description: Tom Stoltman won the event days after travelling to Seville to see Rangers in the Europa League final.

title: Half-term holiday plans in shreds as flights cancelled
description: Passengers are reporting being told at the flight gate that their trip has been cancelled.

title: Mona Lisa: Man dressed as old woman throws cake at da Vinci painting
description: The perpetrator urged people to "think of the earth" while being led away from the scene.

title: Men's U17 European Championship: Dutch 17-year-old Isaac Babadi scores Panenka penalty
description: Watch Netherlands' U17 captain Isaac Babadi calmly score a 'Panenka' penalty to win their shootout against Serbia and send the defending champions to the U17 European Championship final.

title: Platinum Jubilee: Charles and Camilla to join public for lunches
description: Prince Charles and Camilla will be celebrating the Queen's 70-year reign with members of the public.

title: Partygate: How much political danger is Boris Johnson in?
description: After the report into lockdown rule-breaking, political editor Chris Mason assesses the PM's future.

title: Northern Ireland Protocol: Stormont meets as DUP is urged to back Speaker
description: The DUP says the recall is a "stunt" as there has been no progress on its NI Protocol demands.

title: Emma Raducanu to begin Wimbledon preparations in Nottingham
description: Emma Raducanu brings forward the start of her grass-court season and will play at June's Nottingham Open.

title: Budget pasta prices jump 50% as food staples rise
description: Data reveals prices of some everyday items rose by 15% but the average increase is below inflation.

title: Champions League final treatment was really traumatic, fan says
description: Suzanne Gower says what happened to Liverpool fans like her was "dangerous" and left her terrified.

title: Woman tracks down her own stolen car before a police investigation
description: BBC research finds police are taking longer to attend serious offences and charging fewer suspects.

title: Champions League final: Fake tickets triggered Paris final chaos - France
description: The sports minister's comments come amid strong criticism of the policing of Saturday's Champions League final.

title: Che Adams: Scotland striker's nine-year rise from English seventh tier to Premier League
description: BBC Scotland charts striker Che Adams' nine-year rise from earning £40 a week in the seventh tier to Premier League and international football.

title: Ukraine may soon get US long-range MLRS rocket system
description: The US looks set to send the weaponry, but Russia warns it would be a provocative escalation.

title: England v New Zealand: Matty Potts - from confident kid to the brink of his Test debut
description: From the confident kid fighting team-mates to the brink of a Test debut at Lord's, BBC Sport looks into the making of Matty Potts.

title: Ivan Perisic: Inter winger set for Tottenham medical
description: Inter winger Ivan Perisic is set to have a medical at Tottenham on Monday and is expected to join the club on a two-year deal.

title: Nancy Pelosi's husband Paul arrested for drink-driving
description: Paul Pelosi, the partner of the US House speaker, is bailed for $5,000 after a two-vehicle crash.

title: Top Gun: Maverick gives Tom Cruise first $100m opening weekend
description: Top Gun: Maverick is officially Tom Cruise's fastest-selling movie since War of the Worlds in 2005.

title: Champions League final: BBC reporter describes his experience entering the stadium
description: Nick Parrott was among those trying to enter the Stade de France for the Champions League final.

title: Stevenage prom murder inquiry: Teen charged with killing Kajetan Migdal
description: Kajetan Migdal dies from his injuries after an attack while on his way home from a school prom.

title: Ukraine war: Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov denies Putin illness
description: Sergei Lavrov says the Russian president appears in public daily and no sane person would think him ill.

title: Miscarriage: 'We had to put baby’s remains in fridge'
description: A couple who lost their baby say staff had no idea what to do for them when they arrived at A&E.

title: Ukraine war student-turned-soldier: 'Friends die in your arms'
description: After trading university for combat in Kyiv, the young soldier is in the thick of fighting in Donbas.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Bonfire of EU laws' and millions face power cuts
description: Plans to axe dozens of EU laws, and gas shortages caused by the Ukraine war, lead the papers.

title: Cost of living crisis: Relying on food handouts and moving country
description: People from Italy, Brazil, Ghana, Thailand and New Zealand discuss the impact of the cost of living crisis.

title: Peterborough school counsellor tells of her anorexia journey
description: Shama Hanif tells of her her struggle with anorexia and how she has cast off the shame she once felt.

title: Platinum Jubilee: The Queen has sought to be nation's comforter-in-chief
description: The BBC's Mark Easton looks at how the Queen has repeatedly sought to make change easier.
